intro: Leucopogon nanus, commonly known as the dwarf heath, is a small shrub native to the wetlands of southeastern Australia. It typically grows to a height of less than 30 centimeters and features dense clusters of tiny, white flowers. The plant has narrow, leathery leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, adapted to the moist, acidic soils of its habitat. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heaths and heaths. Leucopogon nanus plays an important role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
